metadata.Title: CVE-2011-1204 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Google Chrome before 10.0.648.127 does not properly handle attributes, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (DOM tree corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted document.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-1204` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> qt4-x11 unmaintained upstream (see README.webkit for details)

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
webkitgtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.9-2ubuntu2').
